title: Understanding Error Propagation
text: When you add two measurements, each with its own error, how do you determine the error in the result?

title: Absolute vs. Relative Error
text: Consider whether you should be adding absolute errors or relative errors when combining measurements.

hintAnswer: The absolute errors are added together.
title: Adding Absolute Errors
text: When adding two measurements, the total error is the sum of the absolute errors of each measurement. Which option correctly describes this?
choices: The relative errors are added together.
The absolute errors are added together.
